node.title: Inmate's 2 Death Sentences Vacated After Judge Declares Him Intellectually Disabled
node.description: Pervis Payne was convicted of fatally stabbing Charisse Christopher and Lacie Jo, her 2-year-old daughter, in Millington, Tennessee, a Memphis suburb.

node.title: Biden's Use of Oil Reserves Likely Too Little, Too Late for Thanksgiving Gas Prices
node.description: The president announced Tuesday that he would tap into 50 million barrels of emergency oil reserves. Will motorists notice during their Thanksgiving travels?

node.title: Victoria has recorded 1,196 new local COVID-19 cases and three deaths
node.description: There are now 9,774 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 482 people have died during the state's current Delta outbreak.

node.title: It's just been declared but what is a La Niña and what does it mean for our weather?
node.description: Invisible to us mere mortals on the ground, the atmosphere is full of giant circulations which transport, mix and disperse air and energy around the world.

node.title: Teenage girl charged with murder after alleged stabbing in Queensland's Gulf
node.description: A teenage girl has been charged with murder in relation to the alleged stabbing of a 16-year-old boy in the remote Aboriginal town of Doomadgee, in Queensland's Gulf region.

node.title: Silver Ferns to travel to England
node.description: The Silver Ferns will travel to London in January for the International Quad Series as a part of their buildup to the Commonwealth Games.

node.title: Helen Clark chides international community's pandemic response
node.description: Former prime minister Helen Clark says the wheels are in motion on structural responses to the pandemic preparedness but progress is slow. Audio

node.title: Kāinga Ora policy forces thousands in payouts to terrorised neighbours
node.description: Kāinga Ora's 'sustaining tenancies' policy has cost the taxpayer thousands of dollars in payouts.

node.title: Ohio jury holds major pharmacies accountable for opioid crisis
node.description: Lake and Trumbull counties blamed three chain pharmacies for flood of pills that caused hundreds of overdose deaths, attorneys said.

node.title: Tips for navigating holiday travel
node.description: Experts anticipate even more headaches at airports this holiday season, as record numbers of travelers take to the skies.

node.title: Michigan Hospital Chiefs Say State Can't Wait 'to Correct Course' Amid Winter COVID Surge
node.description: "The vast majority of patients in the ICU and on ventilators are unvaccinated," said chief medical officers representing hospitals in Michigan.

node.title: 'All Is Not Too Well' Viral TikTok Captures Argument Between Couple Over Taylor Swift Song
node.description: "I just want a man to protect me the way he would the reputation of a man he has never met," a commenter said.

node.title: Stewart Rhodes Said Oath Keepers Were in 'More Deadly' Situation Than American Revolution
node.description: Stewart Rhodes, the founder of the Oath Keepers, also accused former President Donald Trump of "complaining" on January 6 but not taking action.

node.title: Staff Shortages Force New York Hospital to Close Emergency Room as Winter COVID Surge Looms
node.description: New York is now reporting a daily average of more than 6,000 new cases, up 56 percent in the last 14 days.

node.title: Brian Laundrie, sole suspect in Gabby Petito's homicide, died by suicide, lawyer confirms
node.description: Brian Laundrie, the sole suspect in the strangulation of his girlfriend Gabby Petito during their US road trip, took his own life, according to a lawyer for his family .

node.title: WA politicians told to get vaccinated by cut-off date, or face being locked out of parliament
node.description: Politicians find themselves in a similar boat as ordinary West Australian workers as they, too, are warned they will be locked out of their workplace if they fail to meet a COVID-19 vaccination deadline.

node.title: Boy drowns in backyard pool in Adelaide's north
node.description: A seven-year-old boy drowns in a swimming pool in Para Hills West.

node.title: Jetstar pilot remains in custody as police work to solve missing campers case
node.description: Police arrest and interview 55-year-old pilot Greg Lynn and examine his 4WD for forensic evidence as they investigate the disappearance of Russell Hill and Carol Clay in Victoria's remote high country in March last year.

node.title: Best Buy Says Theft is a Reason for Profit Decline as Organized Robberies Increase in U.S.
node.description: Retailers have seen an increased amount of thefts, with several smash-and-grabs just in the past week. Companies like Best Buy say it's affecting their profits.

node.title: Foodbank charity feeding 74,000 hungry SA children a month
node.description: Some 135,000 South Australians are relying on the Foodbank charity for groceries every month as rising living costs continue to eat away at household food budgets.

node.title: Nineteen Covid-19 deaths announced as Victoria closes in on 90% vaccination rate
node.description: Nineteen people have died of Covid-19 in Victoria - the second highest daily death total since the current outbreak began in the state.

node.title: In Venezuela’s Flawed Vote, Maduro Shows One Way to Retain Power
node.description: European observers said the elections were neither free nor fair. They showed how President Nicolás Maduro’s government, however unpopular, can win by excluding and splitting opponents.

node.title: U.S. Bomber Flights Prompt Russia, China to Announce Military Cooperation
node.description: The Russian Defense Ministry said that the nations "expressed a shared interest in stepping up strategic military exercises and joint patrols."

node.title: Alabama, Wisconsin Among Football Teams in Player Safety Study Using Mouthguard Sensors
node.description: Ten NFL teams have used the sensor mouthguards for years, but a league official said they also wanted to study research schools with strong football programs.

node.title: St Peter's sexual abuse apology likely to trigger further claims
node.description: The revelations of historical abuse at a prominent Waikato boarding school is expected to trigger more claims from former students.

node.title: Watch Live: Waukesha parade crash suspect makes first court appearance
node.description: Five people died and 48 were injured when Brooks allegedly drove his SUV into a Wisconsin holiday parade Sunday.

node.title: Zena Stein, 99, Dies; Researcher Championed Women’s Health
node.description: She studied the impact of AIDS on women and explored the effects of famine and poverty on health with an “unwavering commitment to social justice.”

node.title: With cases surging, officials in the Buffalo area are the first in New York to bring back a mask mandate.
node.description: Cases have doubled in Erie County over four weeks, prompting the return of a mask requirement for stores, restaurants, bars, salons, and other public indoor spaces.

node.title: Kāinga Ora reconsidering evictions policy, minister says
node.description: Minister Poto Williams says a case in Whangārei is now before the justice system - and while evictions remain a 'last resort', the government will not accept adding to homelessness.

node.title: Proud Boys, Oath Keepers subpoenaed by January 6 committee
node.description: Chairman Bennie Thompson said the groups and their leaders "have relevant information about how violence erupted at the Capitol and the preparation leading up to this violent attack."
